release.action: Reset() function now check for the presence of a reset button.
Add the possibility to manipulate frame (and iframe) by ID in addition to their name.
Add saveAs(File f) and assertDownloadedFileEquals(File expected) methods to check downloaded response as a binary File.
Add getServeurResponse() method to debug HTTP response.
submit([...]) methods now detect image input elements.
Add setWorkingForm(int index) method to select the current form by its index.
Update to HtmlUnit 1.10.
Fix cookie support. You can now properly manually add cookie to the conversation by using TestContext.addCookie() before calling beginAt().
Add setExpectedJavascript[Alert/Confirm/Prompt] methods to check presence of Javascript message boxes.
Add support for Basic and Digest Authentication using Context.setAuthorization(). Context.setNTMLAuthorization() and Context.setProxyAuthorization may also work (not tested).
beginAt and gotoPage now accept absolute URL beginning with "http://", "https://" or "www."
Add new methods: assertCheckBox[Not]Selected(String name, String value) to deal with multiple checkboxes with the same name.
assertButtonPresentWithText(String) was checking on "value" attribut value instead of text between button tag.
selectOption() reset previous setWorkingForm() action. Problematic with 2 selects with same name in 2 different forms.
assertFormParameterValue is now deprecated. Please use more specific method, like assertTextFieldEquals, assertSelectedValueEqual, ...
Add assertHiddenFieldPresent method to check presence of an hidden field with given value.
Add assertTextFieldEquals method to check content of a text field (text input, password input, textarea).
setTextField is now working with TextArea.
Current form was saved but not reseted when page content change.
Show the getTable() method in WebTestCase to allow custom assertions.
Introduce the setFormElement() back as a deprecated method that wraps setTextField().
Update to HtmlUnit 1.9.
Allow selection of forms with same name (with index). Add setWorkingForm(String nameOrId, int index) to the API.

release.description: After all these great changes, we need a RC.
release.action: Added ability to navigate to windows / assert presence by window id.
Remove HttpUnit testing engine.
Refactoring of Table assertions to handle perfectly colspan and rowspan.
Added XPath methods to core API.

Split jWebUnit in modules: one for the core (jWebUnit API), one for the tests (that all plugins should pass), and one for each plugin (currently HtmlUnit). This way, for example, when you want to use one plugin, you don't have to include all others dependencies.
Updated to Jetty 6 for running tests. Need less dependencies and run faster.
Added HtmlUnitDialog, that provide better Javascript support.
Added Maven 2 support. There are many reports available on the website.
Added new method to clickButtonWithText. I believe it is useful addition to existing functionality as we already have assertButtonPresentWithText().
Integrated patch for multiple submit buttons with different values. API change - assertSubmitButtonValue(button, value) now assertSubmitButtonPresent(button, value).
Assert button (not) present with text added.
Added ability to navigate to windows / assert presence by window title.
Added assert select option present / not present.
onchange event bug fixed / test added.
Memory leak in WebTestCase. Note: tester is no longer allocated at constructor time, but just before 'setUp' is called.
better support subclassing of WebTestCase
assertTextNotInElement method addition
form assertion failure messages more accurate
assertFormNotPresent method addition
goto a page directly by url
support for clicking links by text when there are multiple links with same text on page
support for multiple checkboxes with different values
Moved the build system from Ant to Maven .
Upgraded all dependencies (httpunit, rhino, nekohtml, xerces, junit) to their newest released version.
Added support for cookies.
Wrong text in Assert
quickstart.html setBaseUrl is mistyped
assertFormElementPresent fails when a form is in an IFRAME
assertLinkPresentWithImage("foo") fails if foo isn't first
broken link in jwebunit-1.1.1 set of files
prevent js files from being returned as response content
Fork enabled for ant-build compile.
Form submit overload for forms with multiple submit buttons.
Support for frames and multiple windows.
Support for non-submit buttons (input type='button').
Support for accessing form elements by display label.
Support for form reset and onReset event.
Fixed problem with onClick javascript event not being triggered by clickLink methods.
HttpUnit 1.5 incorporated, which also replaces jTidy with nekoHtml.
Support for links with images contributed.
Methods were added to assert and navigate links with images by filename.
assertFormElementEmpty method added - a convenience.
assertHasForm renamed to assertFormPresent to be consistent with other methods.
Support for Radio Options.
Methods were added to support interaction with and testing of radio button groups.
Select boxes.
Methods were added to support interaction with and testing of single-select elements. Multi-select elements are not yet supported.
FormControl renamed to FormElement.
Methods related to setting and testing of form input fields were renamed for consistency. All such methods now refer to "FormElement".
InResponse renamed to Present. AssertXInResponse methods were renamed to AssertXPresent for consistency with other method names.

Multiple Form support simplified. The two submitForm methods (submitForm(formName) and submitForm(formName, buttonName)) where removed. To explicitly indicate which form to work with on a multi-form page, use the new setWorkingForm method. The two remaining submit methods (submit() and submit(buttonName)) are used to submit the form when ready.
FormControl renamed to FormElement
ClickLink signature change. clickLink parameter is now the link id. To navigate a link based on text contained in the link, use clickLinkWithText.
Access to HttpUnit Response, Request, WebConversation opened up.
New HttpUnit (1.4.5) utilized, which provides JavaScript support.
HttpUnitDialog class changed to act as a WebClientListener and update the response upon responseReceived call back.
Updated to JUnit 3.8.1.
First release.
